title: Ticket #3167: Fixed length buffers
description:
From Florian Weimer -

BaseShadow::log_except(const char *) in src/condor_shadow.V6.1/baseshadow.cpp and ::log_except(const char *) in src/condor_shadow.std/log_events.cpp copy an error message of unknown length into the statically sized buffer event.message using sprintf(). Please use snprintf() instead.

-

In condor_shadow.V6.1/mpishadow.cpp, there are additional stack-based buffer overflows. (Each case occurs more than once.)

This looks problematic because a job submitter can influence the result of getIwd(): 

    sprintf( pgfilename, "%s/procgroup.%d.%d", getIwd(), getCluster(),
			 getProc() );

It is unclear to me whether a trust boundary is crossed, though.

Host names can be longer than 128 bytes: 

    char mach[128];
    ...
    sprintf( mach, "%s", sin_to_hostname( &sin, NULL ));

All the above should be switched over to MyStrings or snprintf.

MPIShadow::replaceNode() has the following, which is likely harmless due to padding: 

	char node[9];
	...
	sprintf( node, "%d", nodenum );

Buffer size should be increased and sprintf replaced with snprintf.
